questions.question: What was one successful part of the government in the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: Government could tax.
Government had a powerful army.
Government set up system to add new states.
Government had ultimate power.
Articles arguing against the Constitution.
List of issues with King George.
Essays written to support Shay's Rebellion.
Articles arguing for the Constitution.

questions.question: The President vetoing a Bill is an example of what Constitutional principle?

choices.answer: Federalism
Checks and Balances
Popular Sovereignty
Judicial Review

questions.question: Why is the Supreme Court ruling in Marbury v. Madison considered a landmark?

choices.answer: It established lifetime judge terms.
1st case the Supreme Court ever heard.
Court used power to declare a law unconstitutional.
Gave President judge appointment powers.

questions.question: What was the final deal reached with the Great Compromise?

choices.answer: Created a bicameral legislature.
Every state gets an equal number of representative.
Number of state representatives based on population.
Remove the legislative branch from government.

questions.question: What was the major reason Anti-Federalists opposed the ratification of the Constitution?

choices.answer: Too much power given to states.
Individual rights were not protected enough.
Amending the Constitution was too easy.
Federal Court system was too weak.

questions.question: All of the following are true about Alexander Hamilton EXCEPT:

choices.answer: Favored establishment of a National Bank.
Thought Constitution gave government implied powers.
Believed states should pay back their own war debt.
Wanted the government to encourage manufacturing.

questions.question: Why did Framers included federalism, checks & balances, & separation of powers into the Constitution?

choices.answer: Feared a government with unlimited power.
Favored the poor over the rich.
Wanted to expand the democratic process.
Wanted to increase state power.

questions.question: Which of the these would've been supported by Northern Manufacturers and opposed by Southern farmers?

choices.answer: Improving the Port of New Orleans
Expanding slavery into Missouri.
Improving the cotton gin.
Enacting a protective tariff on imports.

questions.question: What is 1 reason Madison & Jefferson opposed Hamilton's financial plan?

choices.answer: Believed national bank was unconstitutional.
Believed in developing industry.
Believed in high tariffs to protect America's businesses.
Believed the whole country should pay back way debt.

questions.question: Why were the Virginia & Kentucky Resolutions passed in response to the Alien & Sedition Act?

choices.answer: Wanted to support Federalist causes.
Wanted to limit state power.
Felt the Acts violated free speech.
Supported government limiting immigration.

questions.question: A political party that supports state power & opposes the national bank & tariffs would be supported by:

choices.answer: A Factory Owner
Shipping Merchant
Northern Shop Owner
Southern Farmer.
